quote: All teachings are mere references. The true experience is living your own life. Then, even the holiest of words are only words.
author: Ming-Dao Deng

quote: Belief is the wound that knowledge heals.
author: Ursula K. Le Guin,  The Telling

quote: Herein lies the supreme wisdom, human and divine; and the task of philosophy consists in teaching men to submit joyously to Necessity which hears nothing and is indifferent to all.
author: Lev Shestov,  Athens and Jerusalem

quote: Religious doctrines … are all illusions, they do not admit of proof, and no one can be compelled to consider them as true or to believe in them.
author: Sigmund Freud,  The Future of an Illusion

quote: Wisdom comes through suffering.Trouble, with its memories of pain,Drips in our hearts as we try to sleep,So men against their willLearn to practice moderation.Favours come to us from gods.
author: Aeschylus,  Agamemnon

quote: My true religion, my faith in God. He gives me love and compassion. I simply return them by loving and being compassionate towards others. Our own heart, our own mind, is the temple of God. The teachings of God is to love one another as he loves us. We love by respecting and being compassionate, whatever they decide to do with their life
author: Ann Marie Aguilar

quote: We have been given God in our souls and Christ in our flesh. We have the power to believe where others deny, to hope where others despair, to love where others hurt.
author: Brennan Manning

quote: Reverence the highest, have patience with the lowest. Let this day's performance of the meanest duty be thy religion. Are the stars too distant, pick up the pebble that lies at thy feet, and from it learn the all.
author: Margaret Fuller

quote: We speak, but it is God who teaches.
author: Augustine of Hippo

quote: Religion is the masterpiece of the art of animal training, for it trains people as to how they shall think.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: Watch any plant or animal and let it teach you acceptance of what is, surrender to the Now.Let it teach you Being.Let it teach you integrity — which means to be one, to be yourself, to be real.Let it teach you how to live and how to die, and how not to make living and dying into a problem.
author: Eckhart Tolle,  The Power of Now: A Guide to Spiritual Enlightenment

quote: Believe in people, they fly for a day. Teach them to believe in themselves, they soar for a lifetime.
author: A.D. Posey

quote: Wisdom is the daughter of experience
author: Leonardo da Vinci

quote: Beliefs that are good promote your potential and enhance your unique special qualities.
author: Deborah Day

quote: Belief consists in accepting the affirmations of the soul; unbelief, in denying them.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Like love, the light or guidance of truth that influences us exists only in living form, not in principles or rules or expectations or advice, however widely circulated
author: Alan W. Watts

quote: As we grow detached from things, we come (with God's help) to master our desires, and we give the mastery over to God. Discipline and divine grace heal the intellect and the will of the effects of concupiscence. We can begin to see things clearly.
author: Scott Hahn,  Lord, Have Mercy: The Healing Power of Confession

quote: To stop war, teach peace, love, cooperation, and most of all—forgiveness.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Talk to me about the truth of religion and I'll listen gladly. Talk to me about the duty of religion and I'll listen submissively. But don't come talking to me about the consolations of religion or I shall suspect that you don't understand.
author: C.S. Lewis,  A Grief Observed

quote: Live in the wisdom of accepted tenderness. Tenderness awakens within the security of knowing we are thoroughly and sincerely liked by someone...Scripture suggests that the essence of the divine nature is compassion and that the heart of God is defined by tenderness.
author: Brennan Manning,  Abba's Child: The Cry of the Heart for Intimate Belonging

quote: I do not know how to teach philosophy without becoming a disturber of the peace.
author: Baruch Spinoza

quote: Religion. A daughter of Hope and Fear, explaining to Ignorance the nature of the Unknowable.
author: Ambrose Bierce

quote: Stand in the divine rain, and seeds of wisdom will grow in your soul.
author: Peter Kreeft

quote: Believe what you believe and it will be, believe what others believe and they will consume you!
author: Stanley Victor Paskavich

quote: To force oneself to believe and to accept a thing without understanding is political, and not spiritual or intellectual.
author: Gautama Buddha

quote: You teach people how to treat you.
author: Oprah Winfrey

quote: We can learn the art of fierce compassion - redefining strength, deconstructing isolation and renewing a sense of community, practicing letting go of rigid us-vs.-them thinking - while cultivating power and clarity in response to difficult situations.
author: Sharon Salzberg

quote: The great moral powers of the soul are faith, hope, and love.
author: Ellen G. White

quote: Why Don't You Practice What You Preach [10w] The reason I teach and preach?In order to learn.
author: Beryl Dov

quote: Life is a succesion of lessons which must be lived to be understood.
author: Helen Keller

quote: Religion, n. A daughter of Hope and Fear, explaining to Ignorance the nature of the Unknowable.
author: Ambrose Bierce,  The Unabridged Devil's Dictionary

quote: Knowledge speaks, but wisdom listens
author: Jimi Hendrix

quote: Understanding is a three edged sword: your side, their side, and the truth.
author: J. Michael Straczynski

quote: To be cheerful when others are in despair, to keep the faith when others falter, to be true even when we feel forsaken—all of these are deeply desired outcomes during the deliberate, divine tutorials which God gives to us—because He loves us. These learning experiences must not be misread as divine indifference. Instead, such tutorials are a part of the divine unfolding.
author: Neal A. Maxwell

quote: Wisdom is the oneness of mind that guides and permeated all things.
author: Heraclitus,  Fragments

quote: The church is not a theological classroom. It is a conversion, confession, repentance, reconciliation, forgiveness and sanctification center, where flawed people place their faith in Christ, gather to know and love him better, and learn to love others as he designed.
author: Paul David Tripp,  Instruments in the Redeemer's Hands: People in Need of Change Helping People in Need of Change

quote: A faith to live by, a self to live with, and a purpose to live for.
author: Bob Harrington

quote: The aim of all Christian education, moreover, is to train the believer in an adult faith that can make him a "new creation", capable of bearing witness in his surroundings to the Christian hope that inspires him.
author: Pope Benedict XVI,  The Sacrament Of Charity: Sacramentum Caritatis

quote: Wisdom. . .is knowing what you have to accept.
author: Wallace Stegner,  Angle of Repose

quote: Life is a succession of lessons which must be lived to be understood.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: The end then of learning is to repair the ruins of our first parents by regaining to know God aright, and out of that knowledge to love him, to imitate him, to be like him, as we may the nearest by possessing our souls of true virtue, which being united to the heavenly grace of faith makes up the highest perfection.
author: John Milton,  Milton on Education, the Tractate of Education,: With Supplementary Extracts from Other Writings of Milton

quote: Christ is the Lesson as well as the Teacher.
author: Darvin Pruitt

quote: The beauty of collaboration between older and younger generations is that we combine strength with wisdom—a surefire way to accomplish more for the glory of God.
author: Brett Harris

quote: Keep me away from the wisdom which does not cry, the philosophy which does not laugh and the greatness which does not bow before children.
author: Kahlil Gibran,  Mirrors of the Soul

quote: religion, the most powerful of the elements which have entered into the formation of moral feeling, having almost always been governed either by the ambition of a hierarchy, seeking control over every department of human conduct, or by the spirit of Puritanism.
author: John Stuart Mill

quote: This world is your best teacher. There is a lesson in everything. There is a lesson in each experience. Learn it and become wise. Every failure is a stepping stone to success. Every difficulty or disappointment is a trial of your faith. Every unpleasant incident or temptation is a test of your inner strength. Therefore nil desperandum. March forward hero!
author: Sivananda Saraswati

quote: We are the Bibles the world is reading; We are the creeds the world is needing; We are the sermons the world is heeding.
author: Billy Graham

quote: The idea of authority, which they represented, was associated in our minds with a greater insight and a more humane wisdom.
author: Erich Maria Remarque,  All Quiet on the Western Front

quote: No religion except ours has taught that man is born in sin; none of the philosophical sects has admitted it; none therefore has spoken the truth
author: Blaise Pascal,  Pensées

quote: Only a very few can be learned, but all can be Christian, all can be devout, and – I shall boldly add – all can be theologians.
author: Desiderius Erasmus
